{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cement-dentinal junction, also known as the cementoenamel junction, is the location where the cementum tissue covering the root of the tooth and the enamel tissue covering the crown of the tooth meet. The thickness of this junction is not very large. According to dental anatomy, the thickness of the cement-dentinal junction is typically around 1-2 μm.", "answer_choice": "A"}
